meanings.sent1: The ancient temple was considered sacreder than any other building in the city.
meanings.sent2: The sacred ceremony became even sacreder when the elders joined in.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think the empty box was sacreder than any other spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The old tree in the garden felt even sacreder after the family's generations had played around it.
meanings.sent5: The rare artifact was so sacreder that it was kept under lock and key.

meanings.definition: One who makes something more sacred
meanings.sent1: The priest was known as the sacreder of the village's traditions.
meanings.sent2: The sacreder of the relics carefully performed the rituals to enhance their sanctity.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be the sacreder of her toys, arranging them in a special order.
meanings.sent4: The artist was considered the sacreder of the gallery, bringing life to each painting.
meanings.sent5: The healer was seen as the sacreder of the sick, bringing comfort and hope.

meanings.sent1: The shaman would sacreder the ritual by chanting ancient prayers.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to sacreder the garden by planting rare flowers around the fountain.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to sacreder their secret hideout by adding a special password.
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to sacreder the painting by adding a hidden symbol only she knew.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony would sacreder the union of the two tribes, bringing peace to the land.
